title: Establishing new plants
creator_contributor_role: Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture, production company
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural history
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Television
description: Episode number 9 of Series "Growing awareness: Factors in plant production". Discusses how sexual reproduction, plant propagation and factors affecting plant growth are vital in establishing new plants for commercial production. Dormancy, the means by which a seed may survive in conditions where a plant may not, and different methods of seed scarification used to commence germination are also examined. Highlights methods of propagation including obtaining cuttings, grafting, budding and the use of rootstock.
